par_to_plot.README: Select here the parameters you want to plot for spms and geds (see 'Available-par' for parameters that are available to study).

pulser.README: Set the following flag to 'true' if you want to plot pulser events; set it to 'false' if you want to plot real events. Set it to 'null' if you want to keep everything

Available-par.Tier-2-par1: A_max, QDrift, bl_intercept, bl_mean, bl_slope, bl_std, cuspEftp, cuspEmax, dt_eff, pz_mean, pz_slope
Available-par.Tier-2-par2: pz_std, tp_01, tp_0_est, tp_10, tp_100, tp_20, tp_50, tp_80, tp_90, tp_95, tp_99, tp_aoe_max, tp_aoe_samp
Available-par.Tier-2-par3: tp_max, tp_min, trapEftp, trapEmax, trapTmax, wf_max, wf_min, zacEftp, zacEmax

event_rate.README: Event rate. Change 'dt' and 'units' if needed.

dt.README: Time interval (in [s]) in which rate is evaluated: rate=cts/dt.

units.README: Select the units you prefer between: mHz, Hz, kHz.

bl_rms.README: Baseline root mean square (available only for data with pulser)

lc.README: Leakage current (available only for data with pulser)

uncal_puls.README: Uncalibrated pulser (available only for data with pulser; dsp files are needed)

status.README: If 'true', detectors' status (OK, OFF, AC, ...) is checked and selected parameters are plotted if a detector is problematic.

time-format.README: Choose the time format of your plots: day/month-time, day/month, time
